title: Anno Mundi
summary: Anno Mundi (from Latin "in the year of the world"; Hebrew: לבריאת העולם‎, Livryat haOlam, "to the creation of the world"), abbreviated as AM or A.M., or Year After Creation,[1] is a  calendar era based on the biblical accounts of the creation of the world and subsequent history. Two such calendar eras have seen notable use historically:
